review_text: This tiny home has everything you could want in a full-size Airbnb! Cyndy has thought of everything to make this little space feel more than enough. Full kitchen, the sink faucet has a light when the water is on, extra sink surface in the bathroom, plenty of towels, all of the bath soaps, lotion, comfortable bed, smart Roku TV, cute outdoor patio, Kurig, Brita, coffee cups and snacks. The driveway was a little steep for us, haha! But Cyndy provided clear directions ahead of time so we would know what to expect. Definitely recommend this tiny home if you need a place to sleep while you’re out-and-about in the area!

Book this place for the PERFECT home away from home!!!

review_text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our Labor Day weekend stay here. The entire experience was excellent, including communication with the property manager and owner, cleanliness, location, and amenities. Everything was just as advertised. The kitchen was well stocked, including little things like spices and zip lock bags. The bathrooms included soap and shampoo and plenty of towels. The mattresses in the bedrooms were super comfortable. The entire place was very cozy. The view of the mountains from the screened-in porch was very scenic. The location was superb, just minutes from the WCU campus, yet it felt so secluded in a very quaint private community. It was very easy to get to Sylva for food and supplies. Also very close to so many activities - including hiking, tubing, kayaking, sight-seeing, the Blue Ridge Parkway, Harrah's and so much more.
Randall and Dawn were superior hosts. They responded very quickly to the questions we had. A few have mentioned the lack or parking and it is advertised as parking for just 2, but we found it very easy to park the three vehicles we had in our party. We would definitely book again!! 10/10.

This place by far was the nicest and the best value out of anything else that we’ve seen. Even the Comfort Inn that was down the street cost significantly more. The house was extremely nicely kept, spacious and comfortable. The location was perfect as well. You’re close to everything you need, but just secluded enough for a quiet and peaceful getaway. We’ll definitely be booking this place again next time! Thank you Dawn and Randall!

Very comfortably furnished - living room seating was most excellent for falling asleep while reading a book... We only used one of the bedrooms, mattress and linens were comfy enough that we were looking for tags to see what they were!
I would absolutely recommend this place to any of my friends looking for a quiet getaway - and if you want to get out and about Jackson County in particular Sylva, Dillsboro, and Cullowhee have plenty of local color, and casual and semi-upscale dining...

review_text: The details and directions provided by the host were very accurate. Please note, the property is on top of a mountain taking a gravel road so make sure you have a vehicle equipped for the trip. There are neighborhood dogs that are very friendly that visit the property. The fire pit was very nice and the deck was perfect for enjoying morning coffee. The layout of the house was perfect, the master is on the opposite side of the house as the other two bedrooms. Rooms are all spacious and clean. You can hear donkeys, cows and dogs from all around with the house being on the mountain. Such a beautiful place. There isn’t a lot of dresser space so you need to rely on closet space. Pots and pans are a bit used but very reliable. Would definitely take my family to this property again. The hosts messaged us to ensure we were enjoying our stay. Very friendly.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We had a wonderful two night stay in this very cozy home. Everything was as described and the home was very clean!
Guests should be sure to save check in instructions before heading to the house. There is no cell service and I made the mistake of not taking a screenshot of the check in code and couldn’t access the Airbnb website with no service.
This is of NO fault of Greta but solely of mine. I should have known better and just want to remind anyone else staying here, don’t expect to access online info until you get logged into the WiFi.
The home was very comfortable, beds were great, kitchen had everything we needed, WiFi worked well and the host was super.
Highly recommend staying here!!

review_text:
Greta's place is comfortable, stylish and very clean. We travel a lot and this is one of the best Airbnb rentals we had. We loved the location, secluded but close to town, in the middle of the area to explore Blue Ridge Parkway, trails, and waterfalls.
We also want to clear up concerns about GPS service.
GPS signals come from the satellites and are accessible almost everywhere. Cell service is provided by antennas and is usually spotty in the mountains. So, you’re losing cell service, not GPS. To keep directions you need to enable, i.e. download, offline maps for the area in Google Maps and it’ll help not only to find directions to the house, but also for other destinations in the mountains. For all our stay we never had any problem with finding the house.
Also, while the road is steep by Florida standards, it’s rather common for the hilly areas and we didn’t have any problems with it, it’s well worth the view from the house.

review_text:
After staying in this house it's easy to see why Greta is rated a super host. What a great place to enjoy the Southern Appalachians. Driving up the holler you get a little bit of a through back experience with the more down-home residences that saddle up to the road and creek bed. You turn left off the little mountain road and head what seems to be about straight up, up a narrow mountain road. If your a flat-lander it gives you a little introduction to mountain living. The house is beautifully situated in a little cove near the top of the mountain with beautiful mountain views and only a couple homesteads nearby. There is a nice hike up behind the house to the top of the mountain. The house is a bit nicer than most Airbnb's I've visited with a beautiful tile shower in one bathroom and a deep tub in the master with bubble bath available. The doors, floors and much of the woodwork is beautiful natural wood. The deck is spacious with beautiful natural wood railing and there also a nice fire circle to sit around in the evenings. Through out the house there were little extras like cookies and snacks, the afore mentioned bubble bath, spies, sugar and other condiments in the kitchen, and we even were treated to ice cream cones in the freezer.
If you don't mind a little drive up the mountain this is a beautiful, comfortable place to stay. We are already making plans to head back.
John Welch

Greta was a great host, quickly responded, supplied some amenities, and when we had some snow, left some emergency supplies at the door for us. But was also very respectful of our privacy. Fair warning that it’s a steep drive up to the house but very worth it for the views. Great stargazing too. We also brought 2 dogs and they loved it! They made quick friends of the mountain dogs (around 4-5 meandered by throughout the week), who were all friendly to our dogs and us. Overall Greta’s place was perfect!

It is only .5 mi from Harrill Hall at WCU (which is why we went) which means campus is technically walking distance, but I wouldn't walk due to the blind curves and hills in the roads. But if you have gone home, looked at your pictures from a place you have been, and thought "the pictures just don't capture what we saw" this is that type of place. The property is on the river and sitting on the porch you can hear the river. The property is very well maintained and gorgeous... Lots more to say, but you have to stay to understand. Thank you to the owners for such a nice property.

review_text:
A spacious and comfortable suite
of rooms perched up in a remote spot in the mountains surrounded by spectacular scenery and lovely hikes. Gavin is a terrific host and quickly accommodated any special requests I had. The king size memory foam mattress is so comfy and I really appreciated the premium sheets and bedding. I also appreciated all the thoughtful little details, like the white noise machine on the bedside table. At first I felt a
little nervous navigating the steep gravel road leading up to the property but I quickly got used to it and I’m glad I had 4WD vehicle. All in all, I would highly recommend this rental for anyone who wants a true mountain getaway.

name: David
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We enjoyed our stay at Margo's small and cozy cabin. The weather varied during our week-long stay in Cullowhee, but anything we needed to stay comfortable was already somewhere in the space. The kitchen had all the utensils we would need. The building and the spaces inside (living/kitchen area, upstairs bedroom, porch and balcony) are unique, sometimes quirky, but the art, artifacts, and furnishings are always warm and inviting. Even though the cabin is part of a neighborhood, its placement and resulting views make the place feel very private. The view over the balcony is of trees and mountains only.
Do keep in mind, the space is small, the kitchen diminutive (but very functional), and the shower space best for one person at a time. You could have more than two people stay---there is a pull-out settee for an extra sleeping place---but you can't mind being pretty close to each other most of the time! Use the extra balcony space as much as you can.
We were lucky to see hummingbirds at the feeder Margo provides on the balcony. Maybe you will too!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The premises is not as private as the pictures make it seem. We expected to have a small plot surrounded by the woods, but the Whee House is actually in the backyard of the host, only about 50 feet from the main house. Even the more private balcony off the back of the Whee House was in view of the main house, which was not the type of unit we intended to book for our trip.
Despite expecting a more private location, we did enjoy our stay. Margo was very friendly and a good communicator, and her dog Virginia was also very friendly and fun to have around.
There were some slight issues with ants on the kitchen counter and kitchen wall, and the couch and shower smelling a little musty, but these were somewhat expected since it is a cabin by the woods.

review_text: The house and location right on the river were exactly as shown in the listing. Very clean and the house looks and feels like new since it has been well maintained and cared for. The screened porch is fabulous from morning to night. Very relaxing listening to the flow of the river. A quiet neighborhood with no through traffic but a very short drive to grocery stores, restaurants and anything you need in Sylva, or Cashiers/Highlands if you want a scenic drive to other beautiful places. We had to go to Asheville on business one day and it was an easy 1 hour drive to our meeting on a nice parkway. All instructions online and in the house were easy to follow and accurate. Dawn and Randall were quick to respond if we needed something but their home and organized set up were so good that no needs were left unmet onsite. We look forward to a return visit!

Our first visit to Southwestern North Carolina was perfect while staying at this property. You're about an hour from Ashville, but it's an easy 4 lane highway drive the whole way. If you don't want to venture that far, within 15 minutes you can find all sorts of breweries, restaurants and little shops in Silva, NC. The Cherokee Casino isn't a far drive as well.
The house is exactly as advertised! If you don't want to do any of the activities listed above, you can always sit on the back patio of the house and listen to the Tuckesegee River flow by. It's hard to describe how fantastic the view and sounds are! we hope to come back some day.

review_text:
The Airbnb was exceptionally well-stocked with all the essentials one could need during their stay. From the fully equipped kitchen to the cozy bedroom, every detail had been carefully thought out. It was evident that the hosts had put a lot of effort into making their guests feel comfortable and at home.
Not only was the place clean and well-equipped, but it also had a modern and stylish aesthetic. The decor was tastefully done, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. It truly felt like a home away from home, and I instantly felt relaxed and at ease.
Overall, my experience at this Airbnb was outstanding, and I would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat. The combination of the incredible river view, the cleanliness, and the modern and stylish ambiance made it a memorable and enjoyable stay. I highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a peaceful and comfortable getaway.

review_text: We had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful home for 4 nights with our dog. The home is modern, very welcoming, spotless, beautifully furnished and had everything we needed to be comfortable. The main outdoor space (screened porch) is beyond relaxing- it is huge and has comfortable furniture. It looks out directly onto the river, the flowing water is mesmerizing. There is also a fire pit beside the river which we did not use this visit. The neighborhood is quiet and it was easy to walk the dog 20-25 minutes without having to go up any steep incline. The wifi worked great and there was a cell signal here (Verizon) (that can be a challenge in this area). The neighborhood is located less than a mile from the edge of the WCU campus. We have stayed at several Airbnb’s in the Cullowhee/Sylva area- this is the best!! Highly recommend!!

Wow! This place was simply stunning! I’ve never seen such an immaculate pet friendly abode! So much so, that we removed our shoes and wiped our pups paws prior to entry. We wanted to respect the home as if it was ours. The bedding was simply elegant and comfortable! If I was to win the lotto, I would submit an offer on this place…lol!!
The place was well stocked, and simply a very relaxing environment. The running river was an added benefit as we sat on the screened in back porch. Outside activities were held at bay due to the weather, but having the heater on the porch was more than adequate for us to enjoy the vistas.
Sunday was a dry day and we made use of the fire pit to BBQ. The neighbors were very observant and friendly, so no security concerns whatsoever!
Randall & Dawn are great communicators and very quick to respond! This will be my go to retreat in the future getaways my family and I plan.

Wow, this place was amazing! We were honestly blown away by our stay. One of the cleanest, nicest, and most relaxing Airbnbs we’ve ever stayed at.
We spent most of our time on the back patio relaxing and listening to the sounds of the river that was just a few feet below. The place even had a super cozy fireplace and a heated outdoor patio area where we spent countless hours.
The location was perfect with easy access to all the nearby grocery stores and restaurants. The place felt very warm and homey. It had everything you could want and more! The view was our favorite part! Sitting on the back patio drinking a glass of wine and watching the sun set on the Tuckasegee River was surreal. Just a feeling of total peace and being so close to nature.
We can’t wait to be back in October to see the beautiful leaves changing colors!

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We stayed over the Christmas break. The cottage is in a beautiful location with great views of the Smoky Mountains. It was clean and cozy, with the added touch of some locally made chocolates as a welcome gift.
Our dog enjoyed spending time on the veranda and walking the local fields behind the cottage.
The town of Sylva is about 10mins away with lots of shops and eateries.
Calvin gave very prompt replies to questions and provided lots of helpful information on areas to visit.
We all had a wonderful trip out to see Dry Falls near Franklin. Great experience of walking behind the waterfall. Then we travelled through the great heights of Blue Ridge Parkway to Waterford Knob. Magnificent views.
Overall, we had an amazing relaxing time and would definitely recommend.
Thank you, Calvin & Kim, for help making our stay a memorable one!
Happy New Year!

The house was very well stocked with all the comforts of home. Both beds were very comfortable memory foam beds, and it is very quiet at night. Everything was spotless. Our host was very responsive to any messages. It was a perfect stay, and I really can't recommend this spot enough. We'll definitely be back when visiting my brother in the area! Thank you, Calvin!

RB

Stayed with a pet
review_text: We stayed at the cottage for 3 nights in January with our dog. It was very convenient for visiting our son at WCU. We love the cottage!! It is homey and cozy and very clean. It is quiet and relaxing. The size is perfect with 2 good sized bedrooms and 2 full baths. There is a large loft sitting area which was my favorite space. There are two televisions. The kitchen has everything you need and is clean and modern. The refrigerator has complimentary wine and chocolates and some staples you can use. Outdoors there is a yard for short dog walks and the adjacent road has little traffic. We did not use the fire pit or outdoor games, it was too cold - but would enjoy doing that next visit. There is a large deck with gates that lock to keep the dog confined. There is nice deck furniture to enjoy the beautiful view. FYI- there is no cell signal (Verizon), but the wifi works great. We look forward to staying here again. Thank you for sharing your cottage.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The location is only a few minutes away from WCU which was perfect as we were attending a WCU orientation. The host provided exceptional instructions and we found the home with no issues. It is a short, easy drive off the main highway with no no steep mountain roads. You would not need a 4x4 to get to this home so a great choice if you drive a smaller vehicle. The hosts have clearly made great efforts to restore this older home and it was absolutely charming as well as being fully functional. We didn't do much cooking but there seemed to be every kitchen tool needed to be able to make full meals, the beds were comfy with clean linens, and everything was spotless. Cell service is pretty much non existent at this location so be sure you have a plan for that. The Wifi however is excellent, even with 3 teens and streaming movies so we were fine with making wifi calls & messaging. I would not hesitate to book this home if we come back to visit our daughter while she attends WCU.

name: Jay
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at the Cottage in Cullowhee was amazing. The cottage was exactly as advertised, a 1940's farmhouse. It felt like stepping back into my Papa's old farmhouse when I was a child, down to the smells and the creaking floors. Although old, it was clean and had all the needed features of modern living. We spent most of our time away form the cabin exploring the nearby attractions... make sure your take a dip in the Tuckasegee river at the East Laporte park and check out the historic petroglyphs of Judaculla rock... but when we came back it was easy to relax. We watched 1 of the 100 DVDs provided one evening, and logged into HULU another. If you must stay connected, the Wifi was strong and a necessity as there is no cell service on the side of the mountain.
The beds were comfotable and clean.
Wildlife was abundant. Every night we saw deer(20+) and rabbits trekking from their hiding spots down to the creek.
This is now on our shortlist of places to stay in Cullowhee.

rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
May 2022
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
When we arrived we needed to sweep and vacuum the floors. Some of the dishes were dirty so we rewashed everything before using, including the coffee pot. There were spider webs and cob webs I swept down. The window glass was loose due to no glazing. The host brought us two screens to provide fresh air, otherwise we could not leave any window or door open. The beds were noisy enough to wake you up. I killed two cock roaches in the kitchen. There was an active carpenter ant colony in one of the kitchen windowsills. Somewhere in the house, we could not locate the source, flies were hatching out of something and for 2 days we killed 2-3 dozen flies each day, then the count was less then none. We bought a couple cans of bug spray and that helped. We bought painters tape and sealed a few openings where we could see outside. There was a gap on the bottom of the front door almost big enough for a mouse to get in. We stuffed towels where necessary.
We made the most of it and just imagined we were tent camping. Nice setting. Neighbors were quiet. Host was responsive about the window screens.

rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
March 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
The biggest detractors from our stay being 5 Stars were the beds. The master bedroom mattress was very uncomfortable, and the base felt unstable. The mattress was extremely loud whenever we moved on the bed.
Our kids said their bed was uncomfortable and loud, too.
That being said, this house is a gem!!!
The hosts are very responsive, communication is great, the tap (well) water is out-of-this-world clean and wonderful! Hot water is amazing, location is very off-the-beaten-path (safe, quiet, no light pollution), great HVAC system, very clean and “one with nature.”
This would be a perfect fit for the right people - I think younger campers/outdoorsy types and/or folks who are looking to unplug and get away from urban stress.
The internet is functional, the speeds are nothing to write home about, but you’ll be just fine if you’re not a digital nomad who relies on fast internet.
There is no reliable cell phone service to speak of in/around the house. Keep that in mind.

name: Cheryl
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
·
July 2018
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: The cottage location and charm have GREAT potential, but there was one serious (to me) issue which overcast our stay. I want to be fair, because there are attractive features regarding the property. Having grown up in a similar house of the same era as Sweet Leaf Cottage (but 90 miles north) I eagerly anticipated our stay. We especially looked forward to time relaxing on the porch and savoring the relatively quiet location, after daily visiting with lots of extended family in from everywhere at a nearby relative's house. Anna's instructions for arriving at the cottage and finding the key were perfectly accurate. Unfortunately, as soon as we entered, the odor of mold or mildew hit us (and I remembered the review comments I had read regarding the odor, which I hadn't seriously considered, thinking the odor had probably been taken care of) ... we decided to open up the whole house (three windows had been left open and had portable screens inserted, so the house wasn't completely closed up when we arrived) and let fresh air help the situation; the many ceiling fans helped with the airing. As we opened windows, we realized only three or four portable screens were available to prop into the windows, and there were no screen-doors. We opened far more windows than we had screens for, and the front and back doors. The fresh air was welcome, but we dreaded darkness when we expected to be overwhelmed by moths and other insects (but the insect invasion wasn't that bad later). Within a half-hour of our arrival I had a headache (and had spent some time on the porch, not all inside the house). Though the odor was diluted somewhat when the house was opened up more, when I woke the next morning, my throat was sore, (and my air was filtered through the CPAP machine I use while sleeping.) My husband isn't as sensitive to spores and didn't like the odor but it didn't affect him as it did me. Our eight-year-old granddaughter sat on the sofa, then said it smelled really bad and asked if she could sit on the floor. (She also mentioned several times feeling as though something was stuck in her throat, most of the time we were there). When she attempted to read in the little room off the dining room, she moved to the porch because, "That little chair in there smells really bad." We sent Anna a text asking if perhaps there were more window screens somewhere, not remembering there is NO mobile phone reception there. She did not get the text until we (and my phone) traveled to town, and she called us promptly after receiving it the next morning, but we had driven to the home we were visiting, also in a mobile phone non-coverage area, so didn't get her voice message until we were in town later that evening. We decided to just let our question about the screens go and didn't attempt to...

rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars

review_text:
Great location with beautiful, mountain views. Very remote so no cell phone service or internet network availability.
Unfortunately, we had a horrible experience with this property. The first thing that greeted us in the house was the ODOR. It can be best described as musty/mildewy smell that lingered our entire stay. Opening windows was not a good remedy for the smell because NONE of the windows had screens in them. There were 3 makeshift screens available, but this house needed to be fumigated with all windows open.
The bath towels and wash clothes were as rough as sandpaper. The bed linens were so worn they had holes in them.
The house was filthy! I have never had to pay a cleaning fee for an airbnb, but this place charged $35 and the place was dirty from top to bottom. I had to sweep the floors when we arrived. There is dust covering everything in the house (don't look at the window sills; they are nothing but filth). The shower had to be cleaned before anyone could use it. When I cleaned the shower, there was brown water running down the walls.
The bed and furniture was extremely uncomfortable. The double bed screeched loudly every time a person rolled over in it (good luck getting any sleep). The green couch had springs poking us in the back.
I do not recommend this property.

Great rental for those visiting students at WCU! Right across & down the block the main entrance from the University and an short (15 walk) with sidewalks to the pedestrian bridge to the campus. Also walking distance to gas station/convenience store and a restaurant we didn’t get to try this time.
Apartment has modern furnishings and design with a cool vibe. Small kitchen was just enough for a few days including a full refrigerator, small kurig and stove top. Lots of nice extras included like k-cups, sugar & creamer, a few cans of soda and some snacks.
Although small designed with great use of space with a Recliner on 1 Side of the bed & a loveseat couch with raisable coffee table making it easy to work while staying.
Great little deck to sit outside and enjoy a cup of coffee.
Russ & Hillary were proactive with communication and
Responsive. Will definitely return when we need to stay for 2+ days.

Russ and Hilary's AirBnB apartment has all the features for a comfortable stay in Cullowhee, NC. The apartment has a great place to sleep, wonderful bathroom, sofa and table to work, well-equipped kitchen, and all the little touches that makes one feel welcome. The pricing is attractive when comparing with other local options. Will definitely book again.
A few words about the location. It is conveniently located just outside WCU. The nearby Great Smoky Mountains and state forests offer wonderful nature escapes. Don't miss out on visiting Cherokee with great opportunities to learn more about the Cherokee people. Sylva is very nearby and has some interesting food options; personal favorite is Dalaya.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is an amazing place to stay and the hosts are top-notch! There were so many special touches and amenities that made our stay extra enjoyable. From relaxing music playing on the tv when we arrived to snacks / drinks available in the kitchen to a basket of essentials in the bathroom in case we forgot something, the hosts made sure that we were well cared for. We met Don after we arrived. He was super friendly and seemed interested to know about us and find out how he could assist with anything we needed. He even gave us a parting gift as a thank you and a way to share their talents with us. The property is shaded and peaceful and we enjoyed rocking in the chairs outside in the evenings. And, the bed was so very comfortable! I can’t say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay and how fortunate we are to have stumbled upon it. This is certainly a place we will stay again when we are in the area. Thank you doesn’t seem like enough to express our sincere gratitude to Don and Renee.

review_text: Don And Renie’s place is great! They are great hosts and very responsive. For example, we were missing a sauté pan ... and they provided one immediately ... and then replaced out whole cooking set the next day! 😀 Additionally the rental is stocked with many many items that made our stay very enjoyable. Don also helped with my car repair (he is an enthusiast). The location is great, with excellent access to the Blue Ride Parkway (BRP) and many hiking trails. Parking is excellent. The area is very safe and somewhat centrally located and near many of the towns. Overall, very impressed and pleased!!! Sylva is also a very nice town, and we particularly like Ilda restaurant.

review_text: I have honestly never had a better experience with a short term rental. Don and Renie introduced themselves immediately via text, gave us all of the information about the apartment and surrounding area, and just made us feel incredibly welcome. We found the apartment to be clean, well appointed, and in a perfect area. The thoughtfulness that went in to every little detail was unmatched...they provided a selection of snacks and drinks and toiletries that you might've left at home, as well as plenty of resources about the area. The furniture and decor were nice, and the bed was actually very comfortable. We honestly had so much fun just looking around the apartment, discovering all of the special touches. Although we checked in late and spent a very short time there, we were able to meet Don in the morning. Meeting a host in person was a first for us, but I'm so glad we did. He was such a nice person, and genuinely cared to know how our stay went. We'll definitely be back. Thank you!

review_text: Don is not just a super host, he’s a super duper host! He went above and beyond to ensure that my sister and I enjoyed our stay while attending our niece’s graduation from WCU. Don was very forthcoming with recommendations to explore the amazing mountains and local restaurants. His referral of Peter’s Pancakes and Waffles did not disappoint. 😊 and we walked off our breakfast nearby at the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. The amenities that Don and Renie provide are by far the best that I’ve experienced at an Airbnb. If there are any toiletries that you forgot, you’ll find it in a lovely ceramic bowl in the most beautiful bathroom with a spectacular steam shower that has 3 shower heads. The fridge was filled with cold drinks, and the kitchen provides an endless supply of coffee, tea, hot chocolate and salty snacks - there’s also a bowl of assorted candy in the living room area. This lovely studio has everything that you need, I highly recommend staying here.

The apartment is located centrally to many outside adventures: hiking, riding trains, white water rafting, tubing, and driving along the Blue Ridge Parkway. Excellent host and hostess who are willing to offer suggestions of areas to visit and are most accommodating if there is anything that you need. This was our second trip and will not be our last!

The apartment also boasts multiple couches, a comfortable reclining bed, dish network and board games. Cleanliness is an important factor when staying anywhere and Don and Renie take pride in providing a clean comfortable environment. I HIGHLY recommend a stay at their studio apartment when visiting Cullowhee. You will not be disappointed! I will definitely be back!

One of the first words that comes to my mind about this apartment is "peaceful." What a quiet and cozy retreat, surrounded by forest and the song of the wood thrush!! It was the perfect "home base" for exploring the local area and then returning for a restful night on the mountain.
We very much enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming again! Thank you Don & Renie!!

When I arrived everything was beautifully setup, with lots of amenities & nice touches throughout the apartment that really made me feel welcome there. This was my first time in Western Carolina and I can truly say this apartment is in a great location, a relatively close drive to big attractions like the Great Smokies & Blue Ridge Parkway, as well as many other lesser known parks and not too far from stores/restaurants in Sylva. Don & Renie were also able to offer up some great recommendations on hiking areas and continually went out of there way to make sure I was as comfortable as possible during my stay!
This was my first time traveling since Covid started, and I also felt that Don & Renie did a great job sanitizing the apartment as well as minimizing human interaction to social distance-- I felt very safe my entire time!
An all-around amazing experience!

There are plenty of towels, a washer and dryer, dishwasher, large refrigerator, microwave, and gas cooktop. It is hard to think of anything that is needed and not provided. But if I had to come up with something, it would be that there isn't a lot of storage space for groceries.And if you wanted to bake a cake, you would be out of luck as there isn't an oven. However, I have a feeling that Renie would happily supply her own oven for the occasion if asked. You can expect the hosts, Renie and Don, to be welcoming and eager for you to have a great stay .

They responded graciously and promptly to every inquiry. They told me multiple times that I should let them know if I needed anything at anytime. I’m honestly not sure what I could have needed because their apartment provided everything from the plush adjustable bed, to the spectacularly beautiful bathroom to the breathtaking mountaintop scenery. Don and Renie are quite simply two kind, gracious human beings who have a beautiful, well cared for Airbnb property. Visit their beautiful mountain home. You will not be disappointed!

name: Rebecca
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2019
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My stay at Don and Renie's studio apartment was wonderful in every way. As hosts, Don and Renie go above and beyond to anticipate any needs their guests might have. If there's something they haven't thought of, they want their guests to let them know. Since the apartment is attached to their house but with distinctly separate entrances, they are available but very respectful of your privacy. As you walk in through the sliding glass doors, the apartment is cozy and inviting. The huge walk-in shower was amazing after a day of hiking, and the abundance of soft towels was great. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and cozy comforters to promote a restful night's sleep. The extra touches showed Don and Renie's thoughtfulness: plenty of brochures and maps of the area's attractions, snacks and drinks, a basket of toiletry items if you forgot something, cleaning supplies, and a first aid kit, to name a few. The gas stove and microwave/oven combo made cooking meals very easy. Instruction books for all of the appliances are in the cabinets. The apartment has a TV and WiFi (although I didn't use either during my stay). My phone service is Verizon, and I had good connection even though the location is in the mountains. If you need to do some laundry, there's a stacked washer and dryer with detergent provided in the closet.
On a very personal note, I had scheduled this trip almost last-minute for a quick, weekend getaway. Just hours after my reservation was confirmed, my extended family experienced tragedy. Not knowing yet when funeral arrangements would be, I contacted Don and Renie to let them know that my plans might suddenly change and why. They were very gracious and accommodating for those circumstances. The funeral was delayed, and I kept my reservation knowing that I needed the quiet space to deal with my own emotions. It was a healing place to do that. The peacefulness of sitting on the porch in early morning as I listened to the songs of birds and watched squirrels scamper up and down the trees and wild turkeys strut down the driveway was comforting to my heart.
Don and Renie are very thoughtful and gracious hosts who have provided a tasteful apartment where their guests can relax and be refreshed.
